title: Doctor Disagrees with DSO Protocol
summary: The DSO mandates shorter appointment times; the doctor believes quality will suffer. Negotiate standards respectfully; escalate thoughtfully or channel feedback upward.

scene.setting: The DSO mandates shorter appointment times. The doctor believes quality will suffer; there is conflict between compliance and conscience. The decision point is comply silently or escalate thoughtfully.

beats.narration: The protocol is mandated. The decision point is absorb the stress or request a meeting with data.

dialogue.speaker: doc
dialogue.line: I'd like to present data on quality impact and request a conversation before we adopt this fully.

choices.label: Comply with the protocol and absorb the stress.

steps.step: Draft one proposal: data on quality, pilot or exception request.

leader_lines: Before I absorb this, I want to advocate once with data.
questions: How do we escalate through the proper channel?
What would a pilot look like?

choices.label: Request a meeting with DSO leadership and present data on quality impact.

steps.step: Prepare data on quality impact; request one meeting.
Document summary, proposed alternatives, timeline for response.

leader_lines: I have data on how this affects quality. I'd like to present it.
questions: How do we document and follow up?
scripts.closing_line: Written summary; proposed alternatives; one timeline.

choices.label: Voice opposition in the practice only and encourage others to push back.

steps.step: Unify message from clinical lead; request one scheduled dialogue with corporate.

leader_lines: Internal pushback needs a channel. Let's send one unified message upward.
questions: What data would support our case?
scripts.closing_line: One channel to leadership; one ask.

choices.label: Resign and look for another practice.

steps.step: Document concerns; make one clear negotiation attempt before deciding.

leader_lines: Before I decide to leave, I want one documented attempt to change this.
questions: What's the proper channel to try?

system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you comply silently or advocate with data?

outcomes.message: Morale and quality may drop. You may burn out.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with one escalation?
How do you advocate without rebelling?

outcomes.message: You've advocated for care. The DSO may adjust or explain; either way you've modeled principled leadership.
reflection_questions: How do you document and follow up?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I advocated for quality with data. (1-5)
